job.title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
job.description: <p><strong>Key projects:</strong></p><p>•&nbsp;As a Senior Site Reliability Engineer, you will be responsible for the day-to-day maintenance, operational support, and reliability of Internet-based and in-store systems.</p><p>•&nbsp;On an on­going basis, this position will help identify root causes of operational issues and partner with other team members to drive resolution.</p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Daily Responsibilities:</strong></p><p>•&nbsp;Provide break/fix, customer support, and communication to product teams</p><p>•&nbsp;Create and manage Service Level Indicators (SLIs), and Service Level Objectives (SLOs) using New Relic, and Splunk</p><p>• Resolve performance bottlenecks using data from monitoring tools, and profiling utilities like dotTrace, dotMemory, and PerfView</p><p>•&nbsp;Manage configuration of monitoring, and alerting in New Relic, Splunk, and Pager Duty</p><p>•&nbsp;Implement OS, and application changes as needed using Chef and Jenkins</p><p>•&nbsp;Create and maintain system, process, and training documentation</p><p>• Drive root cause analysis and post-mortem as needed</p><p>•&nbsp;Conduct monthly OS patching and deploy OS, application, and infrastructure changes</p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Qualifications:</strong></p><p>•&nbsp;4-6+ years supporting external, customer-facing web services for a large site</p><p>•&nbsp;4-6+ years installing, configuring, and troubleshooting Windows-based systems and services using IIS and MSSQL</p><p>• 2-3+ years using Chef to manage servers in Windows environment</p><p>•&nbsp;2-3+ years using Splunk, New Relic, and Pager Duty in a large, customer-facing environment</p><p>•&nbsp;2-3+ years managing VIPs, pools, and members on F5 Big IP</p><p>•&nbsp;Outstanding troubleshooting, attention to detail, written and spoken communication skills.</p><p>•&nbsp;Experience defining and using Service Level Indicators (SLIs), and Service Level Objectives (SLOs)</p>
